Method Detail

rotatePoints

public static java.util.List<Point2D_F64> rotatePoints(java.util.List<Point2D_F64> points,
                                                       int numRows,
                                                       int numCols,
                                                       int expectedRows,
                                                       int expectedCols)
Automatically checks and adjusts the points. if the number of rows/columns are swapped the grid is rotated. If no change is needed the original list is returned. Otherwise null is returned if some failure condition is present.

Parameters:
points - Ordered points in a grid.
numRows - Number of rows in grid.
numCols - Number of columns in grid.
expectedRows - Number of expected rows.
expectedCols - Number of expected columns.
Returns:
Points in the correct order/crientation.

rotatePoints

public static java.util.List<Point2D_F64> rotatePoints(java.util.List<Point2D_F64> points,
                                                       int numRows,
                                                       int numCols)
Rotates the grid by 90 degrees in the counter clockwise direction. Useful when the points are organized into a grid that has the number of rows and columns swapped. The returned points will be a grid with the input rows/columns swapped.

Parameters:
points - Ordered points in a grid.
numRows - Number of rows in grid.
numCols - Number of columns in grid.
Returns:
Ordered points.

incrementCircle

public static int incrementCircle(int i,
                                  int dir,
                                  int size)
Returns the next point in the list assuming a cyclical list

Parameters:
i - current index
dir - Direction and amount of increment
size - Size of the list
Returns:
i+dir taking in account the list's cyclical nature

i1 - Second point.
dir - 0 > counting down, 0 < counting up

public static void sortByAngleCCW(Point2D_F64 center,
                                  java.util.List<Point2D_F64> contour)
Sorts the points in counter clockwise direction around the provided point

Parameters:
center - Point that the angle is computed relative to
contour - List of all the points which are to be sorted by angle
